Problem:
class Store { constructor() { this.stock = { apples: 50, oranges: 40 }; this.budget = 1000; } purchaseInventory(item, quantity, pricePerUnit) { if (this.budget >= pricePerUnit * quantity) { this.stock[item] += quantity; this.budget -= pricePerUnit * quantity; } } sellItem(item, quantity, pricePerUnit) { if (this.stock[item] >= quantity) { this.stock[item] -= quantity; this.budget += pricePerUnit * quantity; } } } const groceryStore = new Store(); groceryStore.purchaseInventory('apples', 30, 2); groceryStore.sellItem('oranges', 10, 5);",

If the budget decreases, does it necessarily mean inventory items were purchased?
Explanation: In the given code, the only place the budget decreases is within the 'purchaseInventory' method, which is triggered when items are added to the inventory, causing the budget to decrease by the cost of these items.
